<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

The fixed point semantics work similarly to <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics">fltSemantics</a>.

The width specifies the whole bit width of the underlying scaled integer (with padding if any). The scale represents the number of fractional bits in this type. When HasUnsignedPadding is true and this type is unsigned, the first bit in the value this represents is treated as padding.

Definition at line 34 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h">APFixedPoint.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### fitsInFloatSemantics() {#ab30aaf95486d0b2aac87f3d9e1e450e3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::FixedPointSemantics::fitsInFloatSemantics (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics">fltSemantics</a> &amp; FloatSema) const</>}>
Returns true if this fixed-point semantic with its value bits interpreted as an integer can fit in the given floating point semantic without overflowing to infinity.

For example, a signed 8-bit fixed-point semantic has a maximum and minimum integer representation of 127 and -128, respectively. If both of these values can be represented (possibly inexactly) in the floating point semantic without overflowing, this returns true.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h">APFixedPoint.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/apfixedpoint-cpp/#l00148">148</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/apfixedpoint-cpp">APFixedPoint.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getCommonSemantics() {#a6e44daa940bc6479c419855e43d5f765}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>FixedPointSemantics llvm::FixedPointSemantics::getCommonSemantics (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics">FixedPointSemantics</a> &amp; Other) const</>}>
Return the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics">FixedPointSemantics</a> that allows for calculating the full precision semantic that can precisely represent the precision and ranges of both input values.

This does not compute the resulting semantics for a given binary operation.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h/#l00088">88</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h">APFixedPoint.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/apfixedpoint-cpp/#l00171">171</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/apfixedpoint-cpp">APFixedPoint.cpp</a>.

### getIntegralBits() {#a60827722079f839f42712dacafce3695}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::FixedPointSemantics::getIntegralBits () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the number of integral bits represented by these semantics.

These are separate from the fractional bits and do not include the sign or padding bit.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apfixedpoint-h">APFixedPoint.h</a>.

### toOpaqueInt() {#ae2929b0e3eeba003376ef5515a006882}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint32&#95;t llvm::FixedPointSemantics::toOpaqueInt () const</>}>
Convert the semantics to a 32-bit unsigned integer.

The result is dependent on the host endianness and not stable across LLVM versions. See <a href="#a0bd07c34ae344bc593539aa2adbb9ad2">getFromOpaqueInt()</a> to convert it back to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics">FixedPointSemantics</a> object.

### GetIntegerSemantics() {#aebc9b19a86db06690ffcc4904907e8be}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static FixedPointSemantics llvm::FixedPointSemantics::GetIntegerSemantics (unsigned Width, bool IsSigned)"
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fixedpointsemantics">FixedPointSemantics</a> for an integer type.
